docs.lead_paragraph: Does your husband or wife constantly forget chores and lose track of the calendar? Do you sometimes feel that instead of living with a spouse, you're raising another child? Your marriage may be suffering from attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

headline.main: Attention Disorders Can Take a Toll on Marriage

docs.abstract: Adults with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder may be at increased risk of divorce because symptoms of disorder interfere with marriage; partners without attention problems may feel that ADHD husband or wife is uninvolved in daily chores to keep household running and irresponsible about tasks like picking up children at school or paying bills; therapies and medication can be helpful tools for couple coping with ADHD; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Does your husband or wife constantly forget chores and lose track of the calendar? Do you sometimes feel that instead of living with a spouse, you're raising another child?     Your marriage may be suffering from attention deficit hyperactivity...

docs.lead_paragraph: "Ask an Expert" is a recurring feature on Bucks where you have the opportunity to question big-brained individuals about a particular area of personal finance or consumer affairs.
docs.abstract: Our Medicare expert answers reader questions about what to expect with Medicare when you are retired and turning 65, the options for Medicare coverage of heart attack complications and when you can consult a doctor who isn't accepting new Medicare patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Never mind the start of the second-quarter earnings season for major drug and medical device makers like Johnson & Johnson.
docs.abstract: Congress and F.D.A. are to review genetic testing this week while some major drug makers report their second-quarter earnings.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new type of Alzheimer’s  drug study will, in the boldest effort yet, test the leading hypothesis about how to slow or stop this terrifying brain disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dozens of readers had questions for the Consults blog about the long-term effects of taking sleep medications. Here, Dr. Michael Thorpy and Shelby Freedman Harris of the Montefiore Medical Center Sleep Disorders Center respond.
docs.abstract: Insomnia experts answers readers' questions about the long-term use of sleeping medications.
